rules.natural: Whenever the failure of the previous condition to necessitate quarantine does not hold, an emergency event follows.
Under the condition that the negation of the earlier statement mandating quarantine is false, then it is not the case that an emergency occurs.
If the scenario where non-approval of funding ensures sterilization does not result in facility availability, and the facility is not operational, then a transfer event must happen.
Whenever the implication from non-approved funding to sterilization does not lead to the facility being available, the facility remains operational.
Under the condition that non-approval of funding leads to vaccination, it is not the case that the person is adoptable.
If non-approval of funding necessitates sterilization, then the facility is not available.
Under the condition that funding is not approved, it is not the case that the animal is vaccinated.

facts.natural: It is not the case that an outbreak occurs.
The facility is not under quarantine.
A transfer event does not happen.

target.natural: Funding is approved for the condition.

steps.natural: Provided that it is not the case that either an outbreak occurs or the implication of non-approval of funding leading to vaccination makes a person adoptable, the facility must be quarantined.
Either an outbreak occurs or, if the funding not being approved implies the animal is vaccinated, then the person becomes adoptable.
If the absence of funding approval implies the animal is vaccinated, then the person is adoptable.
Provided that funding is not approved, the animal is vaccinated.
Funding is approved for the condition.
Provided that the conditional from non-approved funding to sterilization fails to guarantee facility availability, then the facility is not operational.
Whenever funding not being approved results in the animal being sterilized, the facility is available.
Whenever funding is not approved, the animal is sterilized.
Funding is approved for the condition.

(A3 ∨ (¬(¬G → A1) → A2)).natural: Either an outbreak occurs or, if the funding not being approved implies the animal is vaccinated, then the person becomes adoptable.

(¬(A3 ∨ (¬(¬G → A1) → A2)) → A4).natural: Provided that it is not the case that either an outbreak occurs or the implication of non-approval of funding leading to vaccination makes a person adoptable, the facility must be quarantined.

(¬(¬(A3 ∨ (¬(¬G → A1) → A2)) → A4) → A5).natural: Whenever the failure of the previous condition to necessitate quarantine does not hold, an emergency event follows.

(¬(¬(A3 ∨ (¬(¬G → A1) → A2)) → A4) → ¬A5.natural: Under the condition that the negation of the earlier statement mandating quarantine is false, then it is not the case that an emergency occurs.

(¬(¬(¬(¬G → A6) → A7) → ¬A8) → A9).natural: If the scenario where non-approval of funding ensures sterilization does not result in facility availability, and the facility is not operational, then a transfer event must happen.

(¬(¬(¬G → A6) → A7) → A8).natural: Whenever the implication from non-approved funding to sterilization does not lead to the facility being available, the facility remains operational.

(¬(¬(¬G → A6) → A7) → ¬A8).natural: Provided that the conditional from non-approved funding to sterilization fails to guarantee facility availability, then the facility is not operational.

(¬(¬G → A1) → A2).natural: If the absence of funding approval implies the animal is vaccinated, then the person is adoptable.

(¬(¬G → A1) → ¬A2).natural: Under the condition that non-approval of funding leads to vaccination, it is not the case that the person is adoptable.

(¬(¬G → A6) → A7).natural: Whenever funding not being approved results in the animal being sterilized, the facility is available.

(¬(¬G → A6) → ¬A7).natural: If non-approval of funding necessitates sterilization, then the facility is not available.

(¬G → A1).natural: Provided that funding is not approved, the animal is vaccinated.

(¬G → A6).natural: Whenever funding is not approved, the animal is sterilized.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: Under the condition that funding is not approved, it is not the case that the animal is vaccinated.

G.natural: Funding is approved for the condition.

¬A3.natural: It is not the case that an outbreak occurs.

¬A4.natural: The facility is not under quarantine.

¬A9.natural: A transfer event does not happen.
